intro: Phacelia gina-glenneae, commonly known as the Gina-Glenne phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
